org.apache.beam.sdk.io.hdfs

Class HDFSFileSource<T,K,V>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.beam.sdk.io.Source<T>
      • org.apache.beam.sdk.io.BoundedSource<T>
        • org.apache.beam.sdk.io.hdfs.HDFSFileSource<T,K,V>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - the type of elements of the result PCollection.
    K - the type of keys to be read from the source via FileInputFormat.
    V - the type of values to be read from the source via FileInputFormat.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, HasDisplayData

    public abstract class HDFSFileSource<T,K,V>
extends BoundedSource<T>
    A BoundedSource for reading files resident in a Hadoop filesystem using a Hadoop file-based input format.

    To read a PCollection of KV key-value pairs from one or more Hadoop files, use from(java.lang.String, java.lang.Class<W>, org.apache.beam.sdk.coders.Coder<T>, org.apache.beam.sdk.transforms.SerializableFunction<org.apache.beam.sdk.values.KV<K, V>, T>) to specify the path(s) of the files to read, the Hadoop FileInputFormat, the key class and the value class.

    A HDFSFileSource can be read from using the Read transform. For example: 

     
 HDFSFileSource<K, V> source = HDFSFileSource.from(path, MyInputFormat.class,
   MyKey.class, MyValue.class);
 PCollection<KV<MyKey, MyValue>> records = Read.from(mySource);

    Implementation note: Since Hadoop's FileInputFormat determines the input splits, this class extends BoundedSource rather than OffsetBasedSource, since the latter dictates input splits.

    See Also:
    Serialized Form

        An estimate of the total size (in bytes) of the data that would be read from this source. This estimate is in terms of external storage size, before any decompression or other processing done by the reader.
